result.execSummary:
The defendant Robbiel L Stokes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo anger management and comply with any recommendations
AODA and comply with any recommendations

timeConds.notes: Sentence is imposed/stayed, to be lifted if defendant has a positive drug test for controlled substances w/out valid prescription, defendant granted Huber privileges under rules and regulations of the Columbia County Jail

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robbiel L Stokes in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Clifford Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond poster H.L. requesting bond be returned to her, Atty Burdon/Atty Hughes agree with bond being returned, Court grants posted bond be returned to poster H.L. in 15 CF 433
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Robbiel L Stokes in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 14 CF 297, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 14 CF 297 and 15 CF 433 dismissed, read in, 14 CF 297, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, 30 days jail w/Huber imposed/stayed, to be lifted if defendant has a positive drug test for any controlled substances w/out a valid prescription, firearms restriction, $518.00 costs, DNA Sample, AODA and comply, Anger Management Counseling, 3 days sentence credit,
